Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Allow control of Sorting when searching from PMUI" (#7992) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
NuGet Client request to allow sorting on the Browse tab will require Server changes as well.

### Describe the solution you'd like
What changes would be necessary on Server to handle such a feature? Perhaps it should be limited to a single source?

### Additional context
https://github.com/nuget/home/issues/2585

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PackageManagerUI should abstract use of PackageReference for VS.Oe scenarios" (#9907) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: PM UI needs to abstract the use of PackageReference to better support serializability for online scenarios.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Research if performance improvement can be done for non-sdk style projects in PM UI which are slow" (#9906) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.7.0.6726
VS Version: Public\16.7

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. It's follow up from [`Nuget Solution Package manager UI is slow because restore is run for every project instead of after all projects are updated #6010`](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6010) where @zivkan inquired if same logic of performance improvement [can be done](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3559#discussion_r467179449) for non-sdk style project.
2. I believe most likely it can be done and worth shot. Because still millions of legacy projects out there which still need support.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CVE-2020-1340 - NuGet Gallery Spoofing Vulnerability" (#45) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
A spoofing vulnerability exists when the NuGet Gallery does not properly sanitize input on package metadata values. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could perform cross-site scripting attacks and run scripts in the security context of the user viewing the malicious content.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker with permissions to upload packages could publish specially crafted content on a gallery page.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how NuGet Gallery sanitizes input.

**MSRC Security Guidance:** [CVE-2020-1340](https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1340)
**Security Update:** [v2020.06.09](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/releases/tag/v2020.06.09)
